::Savanna::

She sat in the corner in bot mode.  She was listening intently on 
Phobia's words.  She wondered what the catch was.  On the pride 
plains, a free peice of meat was usually a trap.  She wondered if the 
tidbit that Phobia was telling them was the bait and if the trap 
would soon spring.  Her instincts told her to listen ad wait.  
Something about Phobia triggered her interest.  She still wondered 
what the catch was for him to come here like this.  Sure she would 
not do as he was. Or would she if the situation was reversed?


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> (OK, I'll start with 6520, 21) sorry so long.
> 
> "My dear lion, I have the information that will end the war, unless 
> we do something to save it."
> 
> Phobia looks at the 4 Maximals seated, and standing at the 
table,"As 
> a show of trust I will give you a little information about myself." 
> The spider paused wondering if he was giving them to much 
> information, then continued "I was stationed on a warship sent to 
> locate a colony on the planet Metallasis, when we arrived we found 
no 
> evidence of a colony existing on the planet.
> 
> The sly Predicon observed the attentive looks on three of the 
> Maximals faceplates. All but Savanna seemed to be caught up in 
> Phobias tale. Savanna had a look on her faceplate like a person 
who'd 
> seen a movie one to many times, and already memorized the ending.
> 
> "While we conducted scans a Temporal wave hit my ship, freezing all 
> electronic systems, including the crew and myself. I awoke on board 
a 
> trader ship. the traders already scavenged the warship and 
virtually 
> everyone on board. I was spared because they needed someone to 
> explain the technology to them." Now was where he had to mince 
words 
> to seem sincere and trustworthy.
> 
> "I worked with the alien traders and learned the controls of thier 
> ship. I assisted them in fitting it with a transwarpdrive. they 
> figured that if they could travell through time and space they'd be 
> able to beat thier competition.
> 
> I had other plans for the ship. I "convinced" the traders to let 
> me "borrow"the ship to track the wave to it's source. When I 
> attempted to contact Predicon HQ on cybertron and they told me 
> there'd never been a colony on Metallasis or a mission to find it."
> 
> "Have I lost anybody yet?" 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, firefox_y2k@h... wrote:
> > -^Hysteria^-
> > 
> > Hysteria sighed deeply, so much for leaving. She stood behind 
> Kluster 
> > while he talked with Phobia. Her eyes nervously darted around the 
> > room. Her beastmode was uncomfortable around lions, and it was 
> > effecting her logic circuits. Still, she would be alright, she 
just 
> > had to keep her beastmode under control. 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > > ::Kluster::
> > > 
> > > Kluster shakes his head. "We're not here to leave. We were sent
> > here 
> > to help 
> > > the Maximals."
> > > 
> > > He turns serious. "Down to buisness," he says, turning to 
Phobia, 
> > "What's 
> > > this info you wanted to share with us, and why is it worth 
> risking 
> > being 
> > > scrapped by both us and the predacons, when they find out you 
> > betrayed them?"
